short_description: RtChangePointDetection function detects change point for real time data.
long_description: RtChangePointDetection function detects change point for real time data.

input_tables.name: input
input_tables.rDescription: This table defining the input time series data.
input_tables.description: This table defining the input time series data.

argument_clauses.name: ValueColumn
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the name of the input table column that contains the time series data.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the name of the input table column that contains the time series data.

argument_clauses.name: Accumulate
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the names of the input table columns to copy to the output table. Tip: To identify change points in the output table, specify the columns that appear in partition_exp and order_by_exp
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the names of the input table columns to copy to the output table. Tip: To identify change points in the output table, specify the columns that appear in partition_exp and order_by_exp

argument_clauses.name: SegmentationMethod
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the segmentation method, normal distribution (in each segment, the data is in a normal distribution). This is the default and only possible value.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the segmentation method, normal distribution (in each segment, the data is in a normal distribution). This is the default and only possible value.

argument_clauses.name: WindowSize
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the size of the sliding window. The ideal window size depends heavily on the data. You might need to experiment with this value. The default value is 10.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the size of the sliding window. The ideal window size depends heavily on the data. You might need to experiment with this value. The default value is 10.

argument_clauses.name: Threshold
argument_clauses.rDescription: A double threshold value. Specifies a DOUBLE PRECISION value that the function compares to ln(L1)−ln(L0). The definition of Log(L1) and Log(L0) are in “Background”. They are the logarithms of L1 and L2. The default value is 10.
argument_clauses.description: A double threshold value. Specifies a DOUBLE PRECISION value that the function compares to ln(L1)−ln(L0). The definition of Log(L1) and Log(L0) are in “Background”. They are the logarithms of L1 and L2. The default value is 10.

argument_clauses.name: OutputOption
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the output table columns. The default value is 'CHANGEPOINT'.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the output table columns. The default value is 'CHANGEPOINT'.
